name: Insurable interest in property required
text:
ARTICLE 10E
PROPERTY INSURANCE

 §431:10E-101    No contract of insurance on property or of any interest therein or arising therefrom shall be enforceable except for the benefit of persons having an insurable interest in the property insured.  Insurable interest means any lawful and substantial economic interest in the safety or preservation of the subject of the insurance free from loss, destruction, or pecuniary damage. [L 1987, c 347, pt of §2]
